affiliations.value: Department of Physics, Lomonosov Moscow State University, 119991 Moscow, Russian Federation
A.A. Logunov Institute for High Energy Physics, NRC “Kurchatov Institute,” 142281 Protvino, Russian Federation

titles.title: Bound on a diffuse flux of ultrahigh energy neutrinos in the Arkani-Hamed–Dimopoulos–Dvali model

copyright.statement: Published by the American Physical Society

abstracts.value: The search for downward-going and Earth-skimming ultrahigh energy cosmic neutrinos by the Surface Detector array of the Pierre Auger Observatory (PAO) is analyzed in a framework of the Arkani-Hamed–Dimopoulos–Dvali (ADD) model with <math><mi>n</mi></math> large extra dimensions under the assumption that the diffuse neutrino flux <math><mi>d</mi><msub><mi>N</mi><mi>ν</mi></msub><mo>/</mo><mi>d</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>ν</mi></msub></math> has the form <math><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mi>E</mi><mi>ν</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></math> in the energy range <math><mrow><mn>1</mn><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mi>–</mi><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>eV</mi></mrow></math>. The upper bound on the flux normalization <math><mi>k</mi></math> is obtained in the ADD model, taking into account that no neutrino events were found at the PAO. It is shown that for some values of <math><mi>n</mi></math> and (<math><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>)-dimensional Planck scale <math><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>D</mi></msub></math> our bound on <math><mi>k</mi></math> is more stringent than that of the Pierre Auger Collaboration. The lower bound on <math><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>D</mi></msub></math> as a function of <math><mi>n</mi></math> is obtained.
